page.title: 10THE BRIGHTON BYPASS
page.content: Most people were against the bypass.The main reasons being that it would destroy much of the Downland landscape,Patcham Court Farm would be cut off from its farmlad and that it would increase the noise level considerably in the Makie Avenue area. Not all the interviewies were against the bypass.The main advantages thought to be less cars using residential streets to avoid congestion on the main roads,it would remove East-West traffic from the Town Centre and that it would reduce accidents by 10%. Most people knew how the bypass would effect them and this information came from the newspapers,the radio or visiting the Town Hall.The majority felt that the Â£50 million bill would not be money well spent.
